communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

The incident report and any supplements, such as police narratives, produced in relation to the shooting incident at Rocori High School on September 24, 2003.

In the event that there are fees, I would request a waiver, as I am a member of a nonprofit media outlet and these records will be used in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

I would prefer the request filed electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Ben Baker

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Hazelwood PD FOIA Logs 2021, 2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Your agency's Freedom of Information Request logs for calendar years of 2021 and 2022. These logs should include a request date, description of records requested, requester organization (if applicable) and current status of the requests.

Further, I request that this document be sent in any digital formats in which it exists (such as PDF and Excel). Under the terms of the E-FOIA Amendments of 1996, Section 5, if a document exists in electronic format, it must be released in that format upon request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Hawkins

communications.subject: FOIA Request
communications.communication:
Mr. Hawkins:
At the outset, please note that the City is not subject to the federal Freedom of Information Act and all references to that Act are an error. The City is subject to the Missouri Sunshine Law (Chapter 610 RSMo) and will be responding to this request under such provisions.
In addition, I have noted that you directed this request specifically to the Police Department and, therefore, I will only be responding with respect to records retained by the Police Department. If you intended this request to encompass all city records, please let me know immediately as it should be directed to the City Clerk.
The Police Department retains Sunshine Law requests in the same form as they are submitted to the department and are kept in paper format only. Under the Missouri Sunshine Law, local governments are not required to create new records. Therefore, we will provide you with copies of the sunshine law requests that were submitted to the Police Department during the relevant time period.
Due to the scope of your request, it will take additional time to research the paper copies of the records, redact any information (such as social security numbers) that may be closed by law, and either copy or scan the records. I estimate that it will take approximately _2_ weeks.
In addition, given the work involved, a deposit of $25.00 will be required to begin the work. The research will not commence until your deposit is received. I will then work until the deposit is exhausted and provide an update on the status of the work. If the deposit exceeds the cost of the actual work, the difference will be refunded to you. If the actual work exceeds the amount of the deposit, you will be required to pay the additional costs of the work.
Again, I will not begin work until the deposit is received. I await the payment of the deposit.

Sean Madden
Records Clerk
Hazelwood PD
314-513-5212
smmadden@hazelwoodmo.org

[cid:image002.png@01D9DB4E.FC94C300]

title: Freedom of Information Act Request: Summaries of oral decisions by Immigration Judge Burns, John - IJ code "JHB,"
tags: new york city highest denied immigration judge
ex ice attorney now immigration judge

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Freedom of Information Act Request: Summaries of oral decisions by Immigration Judge Burns, John - IJ code "JHB,"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Summary of oral decisions of Immigration Judge John P. Burns Dated 04/01/2021 – 04/30/2023.

The term "Summary of Oral Decisions" refers to the official opinions issued by the immigration court in the form of concise summaries, intended for the convenience of the parties involved. These summaries aim to capture the essential points of oral decisions made during specific proceedings. It's important to note that these summaries are not meant to replace the original oral decisions but rather to serve as supplementary aids for better comprehension.

Regarding the specific request for "oral decision of immigration judge John Burns" with the IJ code "JHB," I understand that due to an ongoing backlog, locating Summaries of Decisions that have not yet been electronically filed could be challenging at this time. For this reason, I am requesting the production of all eROPs (electronically stored Summaries of Decisions) for the sake of efficiency. This request is made on behalf of the Deportation Accountability Project, a non-profit organization that aims to make deportation data publicly accessible. These records will be made available on our website, www.deportationaccountabilityproject.org.

Furthermore, I request that if one aspect of this request will take significantly longer than the other, please release the documents as they become accessible.
We would appreciate your assistance in randomly selecting 50 eROPs while ensuring the exclusion of any 'Summary of Oral Decisions' associated with Absentia Orders of Removal and 'MOTION TO TERMINATE REMOVAL PROCEEDINGS.
We hold a specific interest in the respondent's country of origin, namely China, India, and Bangladesh.

Fee Waiver Request:
In accordance with 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii) and 6 C.F.R. § 5.11(k), I request a waiver of fees associated with processing this request for records. The subject of this request concerns the operations of the federal government, and the disclosures will likely contribute to a better understanding of relevant government procedures by the general public in a significant way. 6 C.F.R. § 5.11(k)(1)(i).

I request a waiver of fees because disclosure of the requested information is “in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government.” 6 C.F.R. § 5.11(k)(1)(i); see also 6 C.F.R. § 5.11(k)(2)(i)-(iv). Understanding how the BIA and the Immigration Courts operate, including whether they comply with the Immigration statute, the federal immigration regulations, and the binding precedents of federal courts is of grave national importance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

ABIR APON

communications.subject: EOIR FOIA Requests No Longer Accepted by Email
communications.communication:
Dear Requester:

Thank you for contacting the Executive Office for Immigration Review. Please read this email in its entirety for important information about upcoming improvements to the EOIR Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) and Privacy Act (PA) request process.

As of December 1, 2022, EOIR no longer accepts FOIA or PA requests by email. EOIR strongly encourages individuals to submit FOIA and PA requests through EOIR's Public Access Link (PAL)<https://foia.eoir.justice.gov/app/Home.aspx>. We will continue to monitor this inbox for correspondence other than initial FOIA requests.

PAL offers several benefits for individuals submitting a FOIA or PA request to EOIR:

  *   Nearly instant submission of requests;
  *   Ability to track status of requests;
  *   Ability to browse the FOIA Reading Room;
  *   Payment of required fees online;
  *   Response to requests immediately upon processing;
  *   Receive email alerts as soon as requested records are ready; and
  *   Downloadable records at any time after processing.
To submit your FOIA or PA request, visit PAL<https://foia.eoir.justice.gov/app/Home.aspx> to register for an account.

PAL provides accelerated processing and delivery of EOIR’s response to your FOIA requests, but we understand it may not be right for everyone. If you prefer, you may still send your requests via postal mail. The mailing address for the EOIR FOIA Service Center is available at https://foia.eoir.justice.gov/app/Home.aspx.

As a reminder, the Request an ROP<https://www.justice.gov/eoir/ROPrequest> process is available to those requesting a Record of Proceeding (ROP) for a case before an immigration court or the Board of Immigration Appeals (BIA). The Request an ROP process allows an individual who is the subject of a ROP, or someone with a specific legal relationship with that person, to submit an ROP request directly to the applicable immigration court or the BIA, rather than to the FOIA team. Requesters may use the Request an ROP process in lieu of or in addition to the FOIA request process. However, please note that requesting an ROP through both processes may result in significantly delayed delivery. For more information, see the ROP Request Instructions<https://www.justice.gov/eoir/ROPrequest>.

Please be advised that if you have multiple accounts, which could be connected to PAL requests or e-mail/mail requests, we will no longer merge the accounts together. Therefore, it is to your advantage to use your currently existing PAL account (or create a PAL account if you do not have one) and only submit requests under that PAL account moving forward.

We look forward to offering you faster processing times with PAL, although due to the large number of requests we receive, there may still be a slight delay in processing your request. We apologize for this inconvenience and appreciate your understanding and patience.

We will continue to monitor this email for communications regarding existing requests.

Sincerely,

FOIA Service Center
Office of the General Counsel
Executive Office for Immigration Review
Public Access Link (PAL)<https://foia.eoir.justice.gov/app/Home.aspx>

communications.subject: Request Acknowledgement by DOJ-EOIR PAL
communications.communication:
Dear ABIR APON, 

This response acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request by the Executive Office for Immigration Review (EOIR).  Your request has been assigned control number 2023-76687. 

Please be advised that the status of requests submitted through the Public Access Link (PAL) may be tracked at https://foia.eoir.justice.gov/app/Home.aspx, and you will receive an email response to your request upon completion of processing. The status of requests submitted by email or mail may not be trackable through the PAL, but you will still receive an email or mailed response to your request upon completion of processing. (https://foia.eoir.justice.gov/app/Home.aspx) Please ensure the email address you provided in PAL will be able to receive the messages we send you. Messages rejected by your email account will not be rerouted to you. 
Please be aware that EOIR is a component of the Department of Justice and the custodian of records for the “Record of Proceedings” (ROP), which is the compilation of documents and digital audio recordings produced in proceedings before the immigration courts and the BIA. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) is the custodian of records for the “A-file,” which is a series of records of a person’s immigration history and is maintained and stored by DHS. EOIR is not the custodian of records for DHS or its components, nor does EOIR have access to DHS’s A-files. EOIR does not create an ROP until matters are initiated by DHS. Nevertheless, EOIR may create and maintain ROPs for proceedings other than removal proceedings (i.e., credible fear reviews, bond hearings). You may request a copy of your Notice to Appear (NTA) and full A-file from DHS. (https://www.dhs.gov/foia) 
Note that parties to immigration cases (including respondents and their representatives of record) have the option to request their Record of Proceedings directly from the immigration court or Board of Immigration Appeals. Please see the instructions here: https://www.justice.gov/eoir/ROPrequest. (https://www.justice.gov/eoir/ROPrequest) 

Please be advised that due to necessary operational changes as a result of the national emergency concerning the novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) outbreak, there may be significant delay in the processing of your request. 

If you have filed a fee waiver request, EOIR will address the fee waiver in a separate letter. Most requests for records of proceedings do not require any fees; however, if the fees for processing the request are estimated to exceed $25.00, EOIR will notify you before processing the request to determine whether you will commit to paying the fee or whether you wish to narrow the scope of your request to reduce the fee. Fees may be charged for searching records at the rate of $4.75 (administrative)/$10.00 (professional) per quarter hour, and for duplication of copies at the rate of $.05 per copy. The first 100 copies and two hours of search time are not charged, and charges must exceed $25.00 before we will charge a fee. 

The FOIA requires an agency to respond within 20 working days after receipt of the request, and EOIR endeavors to meet this standard.  The FOIA permits a ten-day extension of this time period, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B), based on unusual circumstances.  Your request involves “unusual circumstances,” and EOIR is extending the time period to respond by an additional 10 working days because your request requires the collection of records from field offices, or involves a search, collection, and review of voluminous records, or requires consultation with another agency or two or more agency components. 

EOIR FOIA requests are placed in one of three tracks. Track one is for those requests that seek and receive expedited processing pursuant to subsection (a)(6)(E) of the FOIA. Track two is for simple requests that do not involve voluminous records or lengthy consultations with other entities.  Track three is for complex requests that involve voluminous records and for which lengthy or numerous consultations are required, or those requests that may involve sensitive records.  As a matter of default, your request has been placed in track two for simple requests.  If you have requested expedited processing, EOIR will contact you in a separate letter. 

If you have any questions regarding unusual circumstances, you may contact the EOIR FOIA Service Center or FOIA Public Liaison at (703) 605-1297 or EOIR.FOIArequests@usdoj.gov to discuss reformulation or an alternative time frame to process your request, or for any further assistance regarding any aspect of your request. Alternatively, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, Room 2510, 8601 Adelphi Road, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001; e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at (202) 741-5770; toll free at (877) 684-6448; or facsimile at (202) 741-5769. 
 
Sincerely, 

FOIA Intake

title: Records that reference Mental Health Program Services Unit at Santa Rita Jail (Alameda County Board of Supervisors)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Records that reference Mental Health Program Services Unit at Santa Rita Jail (Alameda County Board of Supervisors)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Email correspondence and documents since September 1, 2022 that reference the “Mental Health Program and Services Unit” or “MHPSU” or “Project No. CPPP17C160160000”  at Santa Rita Jail.

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the American Friends Service Committee California Healing Justice Program at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org or by phone at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Records that reference Mental Health Program Services Unit at Santa Rita Jail (Alameda County Board of Supervisors)
communications.communication:
Mr. Linsday-Poland:

Thank you for submitting two public records requests for the information below:

  *   9/12/23 request:  Email correspondence and documents of the County Administrator’s Office since September 1, 2022 that reference the “Mental Health Program and Services Unit” or “MHPSU” or “Project No. CPPP17C160160000” at Santa Rita Jail or “SB 863".
  *   9/13/23 request: “Email correspondence and documents since September 1, 2022 that reference the “Mental Health Program and Services Unit” or “MHPSU” or “Project No. CPPP17C160160000” at Santa Rita Jail.
Attached please find a portion of the records that are responsive to your requests.  Please note that we are still in the process of gathering and reviewing other potentially responsive documents.  Assuming other responsive documents exist, we will provide them on a rolling basis as they become available.

Please note, some documents were withheld because the records are exempt from disclosure under the Public Records Act because they are attorney/client privileged and/or attorney work product.
Best,

Laura Lloyd

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request: Brown
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Metadata for email communications where Community Oversight Board member Joe Brown is either the sender, recipient, CC'ed, or BCC'ed, sent between the dates of 2/16/2021 and 8/17/2023 and containing at least one of the following keywords: "fusus", "LPR", "license plate reader", "Flock", "Motorola", or "contract."

The specific metadata data points I'm interested in are: to address(es), from address, cc address(es), bcc address(es), sent date/time, received date/time, subject line, and names of all attachments. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, and only the specified email metadata. Please do not include duplicate emails. Please provide me with the records in an Excel format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with e.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA - Shared Mailboxes (email) (Dupage County Board)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A CSV export of your agency's Shared Mailboxes (see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/email/about-shared-mailboxes?view=o365-worldwide for more info ) including the following parameters for every shared mailbox:

- Primary SMTP Address
- Date Created

A simple way to retrieve this is by having a member of IT (such as a System Administrator) run the following command in Exchange Online PowerShell (if email is hosted in a Microsoft Exchange environment):

Get-Mailbox -ResultSize Unlimited -RecipientTypeDetails SharedMailbox | Select Name,PrimarySmtpAddress,WhenCreated | Export-CSV -Path .\SharedMailboxes_$((Get-Date).ToString('MM-dd-yyyy_hh-mm-ss')).csv

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

Thank you for your interest in public records of NMDPS. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of New Mexico Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office on 7/6/2023 and given the reference number P030299-070623 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:
State of New Mexico v. Nicholas Ortiz
Case number:
D-101-CR-201500203
AND/OR
D-101-CR-201500087
As the conviction in this case was affirmed by the New Mexico supreme court, I am requesting the following:
Copies of video/audio recording of:
Initial police contact, arrest, interview, statements, or questioning (if any) of Nicholas Ortiz in 2011 or 2012. This includes any
surveillance video, if any.
Police contact, arrest, interview, statements, questioning, or other contact with Ashley Roybal, starting on or around September 2012
to January 2016, if any.
Police contact, arrest interview, statements, questioning, or other contact with Jose Roybal starting on or around September 2012 to
January 2016, if any.

records of relevant text messages obtained by investigators through this time as reported.

would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within
15 business days, as the statute requires.
Sincerely,
Jamie Daly 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek, and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request.  You will be contacted about the availability of records, and/or provided with copies of the records in question within 15 days. If there are associated costs you will be notified, and must pay prior to receipt of the records. 
Any responsive records will be provided immediately if records have been located, they are public records, and there is no associated charge. Otherwise, within 15 days of your request, you will be notified if the DPS has encountered difficulties responding to your request, and provided the DPS’ estimate of when you will receive any records located. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center.

title: FOIL Request for Information on Executive Order No. 4.20

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Information on Executive Order No. 4.20
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to and copies of records and documents related to Executive Order No. 4.20, issued by Governor Kathy Hochul on April 22, 2023, which continues the declaration of a statewide disaster emergency due to healthcare staffing shortages in the State of New York.

Specifically, I am requesting the following information:
1. Data and statistics on the extent of staffing shortages in hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the state, including but not limited to the number of vacant positions, the distribution of these vacancies by facility type and location, and the projected timeline for staffing shortages to continue.

2. Any analyses or reports detailing the impacts of the severe understaffing on critical care provision and the ability to serve vulnerable populations, including estimated patient outcomes, increased wait times, and reduced accessibility to healthcare services.

3. Records and documents relating to the immediate and critical need for supplemental staffing, including the specific measures taken to ensure that hospitals and healthcare facilities are adequately staffed during the disaster emergency.

4. Information on the option analyses conducted to review non-emergency alternatives for addressing healthcare staffing issues, including but not limited to the evaluation of potential programs, initiatives, or other policy options that did not result in the declaration of a state of emergency.

5. Records and documents related to the funding inadequacy for the non-emergency alternatives considered, detailing the reasons why these alternatives were deemed insufficient to address the staffing crisis and the decision-making process leading to the issuance of Executive Order No. 4.20.

6. Information on other possible executive orders that were considered but not enacted in response to the healthcare staffing shortages, including their contents, reasons for dismissal, and any related cost-benefit analyses.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request #R000522-042323
communications.communication:
Re: Appeal for Implicit Denial of FOIL Request (Tracking # R000522-042323)

I am writing to appeal the implicit denial of my Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request dated April 23, 2023, concerning Executive Order No. 4.20. Despite multiple extensions, the Office of the Governor has failed to provide the requested records or a valid reason for denial within the time frame mandated by FOIL.

According to the Committee on Open Government's Advisory Opinion (FOIL-AO-19424), an agency's failure to comply with the time limitations constitutes a "constructive denial" of access, and the requester has the right to appeal.

I kindly request that this appeal be processed expeditiously, as the information sought is of public interest and pertains to a statewide emergency affecting healthcare staffing.

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response within ten business days, as required by FOIL.

communications.subject: [Records Center] FOIL Records Request :: R000522-042323
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: FOIL Records Request of April 23, 2023, Reference # R000522-042323 Dear Jackson Parker, This letter responds to your request dated April 23, 2023, which pursuant to FOIL, requested: 
I request access to and copies of records and documents related to Executive Order No. 4.20, issued by Governor Kathy Hochul on April 22, 2023, which continues the declaration of a statewide disaster emergency due to healthcare staffing shortages in the State of New York. 
Specifically, I am requesting the following information: 
1. Data and statistics on the extent of staffing shortages in hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the state, including but not limited to the number of vacant positions, the distribution of these vacancies by facility type and location, and the projected timeline for staffing shortages to continue. 
2. Any analyses or reports detailing the impacts of the severe understaffing on critical care provision and the ability to serve vulnerable populations, including estimated patient outcomes, increased wait times, and reduced accessibility to healthcare services. 
3. Records and documents relating to the immediate and critical need for supplemental staffing, including the specific measures taken to ensure that hospitals and healthcare facilities are adequately staffed during the disaster emergency. 
4. Information on the option analyses conducted to review non-emergency alternatives for addressing healthcare staffing issues, including but not limited to the evaluation of potential programs, initiatives, or other policy options that did not result in the declaration of a state of emergency. 
5. Records and documents related to the funding inadequacy for the non-emergency alternatives considered, detailing the reasons why these alternatives were deemed insufficient to address the staffing crisis and the decision-making process leading to the issuance of Executive Order No. 4.20. 
6. Information on other possible executive orders that were considered but not enacted in response to the healthcare staffing shortages, including their contents, reasons for dismissal, and any related cost-benefit analyses. To the extent your request is reasonably described with respect to seeking records regarding Executive Order  4.20 issued on April 22, 2023, enclosed at the following link, please find records responsive to parts 1, 2, 3, and 5 of your request FOIL Records Request - R000522-042323.  Please note that records have been withheld pursuant to (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HRWPRG2sxdIKUIwWceCMgRATNQLVWAVk99vfz0SQF7wXebEcqjoJYhNxwl5PmKpsAcw6pzLFT9R2FEc3pIoUBR0-3DNuyR_9RX1dMT-2BV1K9cVOGsQunpMlTURmRAr8bn1vex4VvzHY23LVcAujaw2buJ7DWPwAYaaenJkp5EwitRyIe1EP5yHcbSdLOWgU9eouEKGYyDwfMBREn9s0MIgsyuavBj6HB3IaaGAjXOIkjEC5XhfuORwPetYZz6S-2FYNykq9JgUM0AgJjXO-2B6HlVG7VhAzichOiJ6GXI1VJwlJ9IKJMdPFhQrbAT9M4AQQ4liNme4DeG9tNnNeGM6TEcuQZBk1DN6eW71bmovVPpIHpz-2Fy-2FlKAaSTljwJnassRB-2F044KcjA-2FMX4LFj3d8fIvSHAs2mkh7SrrBstbGb3JKvQnY3UevdIxtLf-2Fiu6WYn9oWs38oj6SMy0FnJjRxU60EtiBdQ2vyB9nz59TQdoBSoXxIFXcrmUaw-3D-3D) Public Officers Law § 87(2)(a) which precludes access to records that are “specifically exempted from disclosure by state or federal statute.” Accordingly, certain records that respond to your request are exempt from production pursuant to Civil Practice Law and Rules §§ 3101(c) and 4503(a) because they constitute attorney work product or confidential communications made between an attorney and his or her client, and, c ertain records that respond to your request are exempt from disclosure because they constitute “inter-agency or intra-agency materials” which are not: statistical or factual tabulations or data; instructions to staff that affect the public; final agency policy or determinations; or external audits.  Public Officers Law § 87(2)(g). 

In addition, Parts 4 and 6 of your request seeks “[i]nformation on the option analyses conducted to review non-emergency alternatives for addressing healthcare staffing issues…” and “[i]nformation on other possible executive orders that were considered but not enacted in response to the healthcare staffing shortages” does not appear to be a request for documents or records, but rather requests an explanation for governmental activities and decisions.  “There is nothing in the Freedom of Information Law or the Open Meetings Law that requires that government officers or employees respond to questions, supply information in response to questions or offer explanations for their governmental activities. Again, the Freedom of Information Law pertains to existing records and specifies that government agencies need not create new records to comply with that law.”  NYS Committee on Open Government FOIL Advisory Opinion 16632a (June 18, 2007). 
Pursuant to Public Officers Law § 89(4)(a), you have thirty (30) days to take a written appeal of this determination.  You may appeal by writing:  FOIL Appeals Officer, Executive Chamber, State Capitol, Albany, New York, 12224. Sincerely, New York State Executive Chamber Records Access Office 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Records Access Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HRWPRG2sxdIKUIwWceCMgRATNQLVWAVk99vfz0SQF7wXebEcqjoJYhNxwl5PmKpsAcw6pzLFT9R2FEc3pIoUBR0-3DT2cT_9RX1dMT-2BV1K9cVOGsQunpMlTURmRAr8bn1vex4VvzHY23LVcAujaw2buJ7DWPwAYaaenJkp5EwitRyIe1EP5yHcbSdLOWgU9eouEKGYyDwfMBREn9s0MIgsyuavBj6HB3IaaGAjXOIkjEC5XhfuORwPetYZz6S-2FYNykq9JgUM0AgJjXO-2B6HlVG7VhAzichOiJ6GXI1VJwlJ9IKJMdPFhQrbAT9M4AQQ4liNme4DeG9tNnNeGM6TEcuQZBk1DN6eW7JL0INDSpxvpgTgm5M2v6ATEEmkaR40Nv6i-2BQfGS516z-2BHTQpqmuOh3UNX9oVkRbAhU8PPaDZd-2FqSq09IU8IbQb-2BbeumASzYXynhJhnxf2wgSxcABy6yzVPsdFdjBJaHOxXpv3KzYzScxmL8-2B199Kg-3D-3D)

title: Open Records Request: VIC Training Materials

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request - VIC Training Materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all training materials, presentations,  assessments, user manuals, and other training documents given to Atlanta Police Department staff who work at Atlanta's Video Integration Center.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request: Pace Emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Metadata of all emails which are to or from, including being CCed or BCCed, Theo Pace from March 1, 2021 to May 31, 2021 containing any of the following keywords: “training center”, "cop city", "APF", and/or “police foundation”.

The specific metadata data points I'm interested in are: to address(es), from address, cc address(es), bcc address(es), sent date/time, received date/time, subject line, and if the email has an attachment. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, and only the specified email metadata. Please provide me the records in an Excel format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Nuisance Ordinance Information Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past two years (August 2021-August 2023) regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as "ordinance"  in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Chronic Illegal Activity Premises" as described in Sec. 8-4-087 in Chicago's city code. 

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:

• any training/presentation materials used in communication, promotions, workshops, seminars, etc

• criminal background checks performed on prospective tenants

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the ordinance

• suspensions or revocation of a residential rental license, against property owners who fail to comply with the requirements of the ordinance 

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance 

• meeting minutes and correspondence between municipality officials, regarding the implementation and enforcement of the  ordinance

• all documents concerning the passage of the nuisance ordinance and any amendments to it, including communications with City elected officials, city staff, and others, and any data relied upon or reviewed as a part of the passage or amendments to the nuisance ordinance since August 2021 to August 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Chicago Request Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Jenny Wadhwa, 
 
 
Thank you for registering with the City of Chicago Public Records Portal. 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, we are excited to share with you that you can now submit FOIA requests through a newly implemented online request system. While you will still be allowed to email your FOIA requests, creating an account and submitting your request online will allow you to check the online portal for the status of requests. You will also receive an email when the records are ready to be downloaded. 
 
Please click here to visit our (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HQBImk7-2Bynhw89FmPm6yuaWsC4gmpg-2FhBMj-2BboHFqhgY0PjJ_hXdirCc-2FrGIFa8PzVWCpFhMGgXcfOleT6sSn9umrdKvEzJY2GTPaYOa-2Bj6Ga7q3Rw0uqRZuz6CFvypWdifqe3yYdKErY3LhtH9NZaTYdrzONhdTRfOX4JvGYOGglhXFtYBGJXJ54LwE-2FC7YtMEnGyrNAw-2BRBSkzhKxCMLHj3hn-2BaF5f2qyelghGu4WMtrltxKFM0GOj-2F330jMOmhFWyBIFU48kqSLIVQ-2FkCKNQPrWj0-3D) Chicago Public Records portal! communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: P878819-091323
communications.communication:
Dear Jenny: 
 
Thank you for your interest in information from the Chicago Police Department. Your FOIA request has been received and is being processed. Your FOIA Center reference number for tracking purposes is: P878819-091323 
You have requested the following records: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past two years (August 2021-August 2023) regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as "ordinance" in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Chronic Illegal Activity Premises" as described in Sec. 8-4-087 in Chicago's city code.

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:

• any training/presentation materials used in communication, promotions, workshops, seminars, etc

• criminal background checks performed on prospective tenants

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the ordinance

• suspensions or revocation of a residential rental license, against property owners who fail to comply with the requirements of the ordinance

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance

• meeting minutes and correspondence between municipality officials, regarding the implementation and enforcement of the ordinance

• all documents concerning the passage of the nuisance ordinance and any amendments to it, including communications with City elected officials, city staff, and others, and any data relied upon or reviewed as a part of the passage or amendments to the nuisance ordinance since August 2021 to August 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-police-department-503%252Fnuisance-ordinance-information-request-151927%252F%253Femail%253Dfoia%252540chicagopolice.org&url_auth_token=AAAjxgY_R7tkelLdgDxlaZN4o7I%3A1qgdmB%3AUQXOESAlYcr82WkZgbrgcoXbUrEs0nmrNz-bdd7yruQ 
Chicago Police Department (CPD) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.  If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the Chicago FOIA Center.

title: Inspector General closed cases 2016 (Defense Intelligence Agency, Office of the Inspector General)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Inspector General closed cases 2016 (Defense Intelligence Agency, Office of the Inspector General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

a copy of the list or printout or database listing of Inspector General investigations closed/reports completed during calendar year 2016. If the list is organized by FY rather than calendar year, the FY 2016 list is sufficient for this request. If no central list or database exists, then I request that the equivalent information be provided in the form of copies of the cover sheet or first page of each IG report completed during calendar year 2016.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

They can be reached at foia1@dodiis.mil<mailto:foia1@dodiis.mil>

Thank you very much.

William Seward
Investigator
Office of the Inspector General
Defense Intelligence Agency

Greetings,

Thank you for contacting the Defense Intelligence Agency. This email is to provide you with an update on your Freedom of Information Request FOIA 00111-2022. This case is currently being tasked out to other elements within the agency and are currently being processed. We will make every effort to process your request as soon as possible and solicit your patience and understanding. However, please keep in mind, we are backlogged with over 1,800 FOIA cases and work on the cases based on date they are received and complexity of each case.

Warm Regards,
DIA FOIA Team

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request: DataWorks Plus
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with DataWorks Plus.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Georgia Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request: DataWorks Plus

title: Union Pacific Federal Railroad Administration Inspections and Reports 2023

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Union Pacific Federal Railroad Administration Inspections and Reports 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

* A list of inspections the FRA has performed on Union Pacific mechanical operations and rolling stock in 2023
* Documents, reports, or other output from said inspections
* A copy of the letter (in PDF format) sent from Amit Bose, FRA's Administrator to Union Pacific on September 8th, 2023

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brandon Galbraith

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Union Pacific Federal Railroad Administration Inspections and Reports 2023
communications.communication:
151817-94900085@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:151817-94900085@requests.muckrock.com>

Attn. Mr. Brandon Galbraith:



This email responds to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Federal Railroad Administration (FRA), dated September 11, 2023, attached. The FOIA and agency regulations require requesters to reasonably describe the record or records sought.  See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3)(A); 49 CFR § 7.24(d). Your request, as described, seeks a significant amount of information and is too broad and complex in nature. Union Pacific is a very large Class 1 Railroad. Under the FOIA and agency regulations, the agency is not required to process requests that require an unreasonably burdensome search.



FRA asks that you reformulate or narrow the scope of your request to limit the burden on the agency. For example, focus on particular states, regions, cities, counties or inspector activities. When a request is properly contoured to provide such specificity, it enables the agency to locate records and process your request within a fair amount of time. As you consider your options to reformulate or narrow your request, please note that some records are publicly available. You may visit FRA's website to search for and locate documents that may assist you in better defining the scope of your request at https://safetydata.fra.dot.gov/officeofsafety/(e.g. railroad accident data or reports, including railroad supplied accident reports for specific accidents).



Please respond within 14 calendar days of the date of this email. If we do not receive a response from you, we will administratively close the request without further processing.  If after we have closed your request, you decide that you are interested in the records, please submit another FOIA request to this office.



You may contact the FOIA Office at FRAFOIA@dot.gov<mailto:FRAFOIA@dot.gov> if you have any questions or need assistance to reformulate or narrow your request.



Sincerely,



THE FOIA Team

Office of the Chief Counsel
Thanks,

Yolanda Brown
DOT/FRA FOIA Analyst
Office of the Chief Counsel
Cell: (202) 961-1631
yolanda.brown@dot.gov<mailto:yolanda.brown@dot.gov>

Also, would my request's burden and complexity be reduced if I instead requested a digital copy of the database(s) or database tables in question containing detailed inspection report data for calendar year 2023?

title: Institutional Press Policies (Northwest Arkansas Community College)

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Institutional Press Policies (Northwest Arkansas Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any policy, guidance, handbook, manual, or standard contract concerning the institution’s interactions or relationship with members of the news media, reporters, or journalists, including but not limited to student journalists. 

2. Any policy, guidance, handbook, or manual concerning the interactions or communications of institutional employees, including faculty, administrators, staff, and student employees, with the news media, reporters, or journalists, including but not limited to student journalists. 

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

This request is made on behalf of the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, a nonprofit and nonpartisan organization that aims to defend and sustain the individual rights of all Americans to free speech and free thought. This request concerns a matter of public interest. The records are sought for the purpose of researching and educating the public about policies affecting student journalists' ability to engage in news gathering and reporting on college and university campuses.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Anne Marie Tamburro.

title: Open Records Request: Community Public Safety Grant

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request: Community Public Safety Grant
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to a press release from Gov. Kemp's office on June 8, 2023, the Governor's office awarded more than $83.5 million in grants for 118 qualified projects as part of the Community Public Safety Grant program. This included a grant of $518,787.50 to the Cherokee County Sheriff's Office described in additional documents provided by the Governor: https://gov.georgia.gov/sites/gov.georgia.gov/files/2023-06/Grantee%20List%20for%20Public%20Safety%20Release1024_2.jpg

Press Release: https://gov.georgia.gov/press-releases/2023-06-08/gov-kemp-announces-835m-community-public-safety-grant-awards#:~:text=In%20accordance%20with%20grant%20requirements,violence%20resulting%20from%20the%20pandemic.

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents from the "Community Public Safety Grant" program for the grant of $518,787.50 received by the Cherokee County Sheriff's Office, as described in the Governor's press release and additional documents.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DHS - Videographers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications (emails, text messages, etc.) and reports, including from field offices, linking to, embedding, or mentioning the following videographers active around the racial justice protests in summer of 2020. I request all records from May 1, 2020 to the date this request is processed. Please search the following keywords: 

- "Andy Ngo:", "Ngo", "Andy Ngô", "Ngô", or "The Post Millennial," as well as all links to and mentions of Ngo's Twitter (@MrAndyNgo or https://twitter.com/MrAndyNgo/)
- "Jorge Ventura", "Ventura", "Daily Caller", as well as links to and mentions of his Twitter (@VenturaReport or https://twitter.com/VenturaReport) and Instagram accounts (https://www.instagram.com/jorgeventuratv). Also links and mentions of the Twitter account @RichieMcGinniss (https://twitter.com/RichieMcGinniss)
- "Elijah Schaffer", "Schaffer", as well as all links to and mentions of his Twitter account (@ElijahSchaffer, or https://twitter.com/ElijahSchaffer) 
- "Julio Rosas", "Rosas", as well as links and mentions of his Twitter account (@Julio_Rosas11, or https://twitter.com/Julio_Rosas11) 
- "Drew Hernandez", as well as all links and mentions of his Twitter account (@DrewHLive, or https://twitter.com/DrewHLive)
- "Kalen D'almeida" and mentions or links to @FromKalen or https://twitter.com/FromKalen
- "Brendan Gutenschwager", "Gutenschwager", and all links and mentions of his Twitter account (@BGOnTheScene, or https://twitter.com/BGOnTheScene)
- "Shelby Talcott", "Talcott", and all links or mentions of her Twitter account (@ShelbyTalcott, or https://twitter.com/ShelbyTalcott)
- "Ford Fischer", "Fischer", as well as all links and mentions of his Twitter account (@FordFischer, https://twitter.com/FordFischer and/or @N2SReports, https://twitter.com/N2SReports) or links under the domain https://news2share.com/start/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hannah Gais

communications.subject: Acknowledgement of receipt of CBP FOIA Request
communications.communication:
Hannah Gais 
411A Highland Ave 
Somerville, MA, 02144 
07/12/2021 
CBP-2021-082913 
Dear Hannah Gais: 
This notice acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) received on 07/12/2021 in which you are seeking for all communications (emails, text messages, etc.) and reports, linking to, embedding, or mentioning the following videographers active around the racial justice protests in summer of 2020.     Please use the following unique FOIA tracking number CBP-2021-082913 to track the status of your request.  If you have not already done so, you must create a FOIAonline account at https://foiaonline.gov.  This is the only method available to check the status of your pending FOIA request. (https://foiaonline.regulations.gov/) 
Provisions of the Act allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS FOIA regulations outlined on the DHS website, https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2016/11/22/2016-28095/freedom-of-information-act-regulations. By submitting your request, you have agreed to pay up to $25.00 in applicable processing fees, if any fees associated with your request exceed this amount, CBP shall contact you; however, the first 100 pages are free. (https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2016/11/22/2016-28095/freedom-of-information-act-regulations) 
Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request.  Consistent with 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, CBP processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt.  Although CBP’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period in certain circumstances pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c).  [As your request seeks documents that will require a thorough and wide-ranging search, CBP will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c). If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office.  We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.] OR [As your request seeks a voluminous amount of separate and distinct records, CBP will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to  6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c).  If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office.  We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.] OR [As the subject matter of your request is of substantial interest to two or more components of CBP or of substantial interest to another agency, we will need to consult with those entities before we issue a final response.  Due to these unusual circumstances, CBP will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c). If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office.  We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.] 
CBP’s FOIA Division is working hard to reduce the amount of time necessary to respond to FOIA requests.  We truly appreciate your continued patience. 
For additional information please consult CBP FOIA website please click on FOIA Act Resources or visit (http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia) http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia. (http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia) 
Sincerely, 
U.S. Customs and Border Protection

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2021-IAFO-00238  READ ME FIRST
communications.communication:
Question:  Are you interested in receiving open source articles, news-clippings, etc on the search terms requested?

For example:

Activity outside of the Hatfield Courthouse has been deemed an unlawful assembly, Portland police tweeted early Friday

  * Police ordered people to disperse to the north and/or west
  * SW 1st Avenue to SW 10th Avenue from SW Columbia Street to SW Harvey Milk Street is now closed
  * At least one individual was arrested by federal officers, video from a Daily Caller reporter showed
 New Media Sources (some page content may change or not be available over time):
- Twitter [PortlandPolice]

Thanks you,

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Minneapolis Aerial Surveillance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All emails, memos, documents, and information pertaining to DHS aviation activity in and around Minneapolis, Minnesota from 6/2020 -- 5/2021, including flight logs and references to the 'Emergency Operations Training Facility' / EOTF at 25 - 37th Avenue NE, Minneapolis, Minnesota. Additionally, I request any documents referencing ASTAR helicopters, Cessna aircraft and the call signs "Omaha49" "Troy49" "Troy127" and "Troy236".

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Richards

communications.subject: Acknowledgement receipt of CBP FOIA Request
communications.communication:
Sam Richards 
411A Highland Ave 
Somerville, MA, 02144 
06/17/2021 
CBP-2021-074976 
Dear Sam Richards: 
This notice acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) received on 06/17/2021 in which you are seeking for documents regarding all emails, memos, documents, and information pertaining to DHS aviation activity in and around Minneapolis, Minnesota from 6/2020 -- 5/2021, including flight logs and references to the 'Emergency Operations Training Facility' / EOTF at 25 - 37th Avenue NE, Minneapolis, Minnesota. Additionally, you request any documents referencing ASTAR helicopters, Cessna aircraft and the call signs "Omaha49" "Troy49" "Troy127" and "Troy236".     Please use the following unique FOIA tracking number CBP-2021-074976 to track the status of your request.  If you have not already done so, you must create a FOIAonline account at https://foiaonline.gov.  This is the only method available to check the status of your pending FOIA request. (https://foiaonline.regulations.gov/) 
Provisions of the Act allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS FOIA regulations outlined on the DHS website, https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2016/11/22/2016-28095/freedom-of-information-act-regulations. By submitting your request, you have agreed to pay up to $25.00 in applicable processing fees, if any fees associated with your request exceed this amount, CBP shall contact you; however, the first 100 pages are free. (https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2016/11/22/2016-28095/freedom-of-information-act-regulations) 
Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request.  Consistent with 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, CBP processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt.  Although CBP’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period in certain circumstances pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c).  [As your request seeks documents that will require a thorough and wide-ranging search, CBP will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c). If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office.  We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.] OR [As your request seeks a voluminous amount of separate and distinct records, CBP will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to  6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c).  If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office.  We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.] OR [As the subject matter of your request is of substantial interest to two or more components of CBP or of substantial interest to another agency, we will need to consult with those entities before we issue a final response.  Due to these unusual circumstances, CBP will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c). If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office.  We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.] 
CBP’s FOIA Division is working hard to reduce the amount of time necessary to respond to FOIA requests.  We truly appreciate your continued patience. 
For additional information please consult CBP FOIA website please click on FOIA Act Resources or visit (http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia) http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia. (http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia) 
Sincerely, 
U.S. Customs and Border Protection

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DHS Tear Gas Shipments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the last 18 months, between February 22, 2021 to August 2019 I seek the following records:

 - Documents sufficient to show the number of less than lethal munitions used by DHS in Portland Oregon.
 - Documents sufficient to show the number of chemical agents used by DHS in Portland Oregon. 
 - Documents sufficient to show the number of re-supplies to DHS in Portland Oregon. 
 - Documents sufficient to show the number of re-supplies to DHS in Portland Oregon. 

For the purposes of processing this FOIA, I am seeking that you search in the FACTS database which should contain the information, per your PIA. Records *may* be located in the SEACATS database or elsewhere. Do not limit your search to FACTs. For the purposes of this FOIA, I am looking for the use of all chemical agents by DHS in Portland. According to DHS records, "chemical agents" include CS gas, tear gas, pepper spray and other forms of "less lethal" weapons. Please search for records inclusively. 

Please be aware that I am searching for records in possession of BOTH DHS HQ and Federal  Protective Services.

DHS FOIA OFFICIAL PROCESSING THIS REQUEST: DO NOT CLOSE THIS REQUEST AFTER SENDING IT TO THE FPS SUBAGENCY. I know as a general practice that DHS will close FOIA requests after forwarding the request to its sub agencies for processing. DO NOT DO THIS. If necessary, please SPLIT the request and assign them new tracking numbers. Again, DO NOT close my request for records in possession of DHS HQ and search for records in your posession. 

This request is being made by Open The Government, a non-profit organization.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Freddy Martinez

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2021-HQFO-00579
communications.communication:
This is an appeal under 5 USC 552. These documents *appear* to either have been previously released or incomplete. Our FOIA covered a wider date range which these documents do not cover. Further, we requested documents from the CASE database but records could be other where. Nowhere in the documents is there reference to weapons being inventoried into or out of CASE for the DHS's area of operation in the Pacific North West, which is where Portland is based.

Freddy Martinez
Open The Government

communications.subject: NT Acknowledgement Letter
communications.communication:
Freddy Martinez 
411A Highland Ave 
Somerville, MA, 02144 
03/09/2021 
CBP-2021-040690 
Dear Freddy Martinez: 
This notice acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) received on 02/25/2021.     Please use the following unique FOIA tracking number CBP-2021-040690 to track the status of your request.  If you have not already done so, you must create a FOIAonline account at https://foiaonline.gov.  This is the only method available to check the status of your pending FOIA request. (https://foiaonline.regulations.gov/) 
Provisions of the Act allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS FOIA regulations outlined on the DHS website, https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2016/11/22/2016-28095/freedom-of-information-act-regulations. By submitting your request, you have agreed to pay up to $25.00 in applicable processing fees, if any fees associated with your request exceed this amount, CBP shall contact you; however, the first 100 pages are free. (https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2016/11/22/2016-28095/freedom-of-information-act-regulations) 
Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request.  Consistent with 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, CBP processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt.  Although CBP’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period in certain circumstances pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c).  [As your request seeks documents that will require a thorough and wide-ranging search, CBP will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c). If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office.  We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.] OR [As your request seeks a voluminous amount of separate and distinct records, CBP will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to  6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c).  If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office.  We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.] OR [As the subject matter of your request is of substantial interest to two or more components of CBP or of substantial interest to another agency, we will need to consult with those entities before we issue a final response.  Due to these unusual circumstances, CBP will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c). If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office.  We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.] 
CBP’s FOIA Division is working hard to reduce the amount of time necessary to respond to FOIA requests.  We truly appreciate your continued patience. 
For additional information please consult CBP FOIA website please click on FOIA Act Resources or visit (http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia) http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia. (http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia) 
Sincerely, 
U.S. Customs and Border Protection

communications.subject: Question re:  Appeal Received in the Mail
communications.communication:
Good evening Mr. Martinez,

I am in receipt of an appeal received by my office or around April 20, 2021 and dated April 14, 2021.  Please allow me to apologize for the delay in addressing your matter as we were behind in the receipt of physical mail.  I have examined your request as well as my supervisor and were are unable to positively identify which case you are filing an appeal on.  It appears that the request is 2021-HQFO-00579 but there are multiple pages identifying multiple requests and even request from another agency.  Please provide a breakdown of what you are seeking and document the actual case that you are seeking records on.  If these numerous requests are linked in some way, please provide a detailed breakdown of what you are seeking and how they are related.  Please note this email does not constitute an official acknowledgement of the receipt of your request.  Before I am able to generate a case file and the associated appeal case number in an acknowledgment I need clarification.  Thank you for your assistance in this matter and I look forward to getting this issue resolved quickly.    Please send your response and/or questions directly to me.

Respectfully,

Sharon R. Deshield
Department of Homeland Security, HQ
Office of the Secretary and Executive Management
Litigation and Appeals
Privacy Office
Email:  sharon.deshield@hq.dhs.gov<mailto:sharon.deshield@hq.dhs.gov>


"Never look down on someone...unless you are helping them up!"  Unknown

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Files mentioning or describing the creation or use of the Organized Crime Information System (OCIS), including but not limited to manuals, guides and briefings.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best
